priority_1: enhancement of women participation in electoral process
priority_2: use of technology/AI for monitoring & countering mis/dis information
priority_3: electoral reforms and adoption of best international practices.
documentation_challenges: Minor challenges which were resolved through updation of softwares.
tech_adoption_barriers: Weak last-mile infrastructure and digital literacy and skills gap among election officials leading to low confidence, resistance to change and inconsistent use of new systems.
implementation_concerns: resistance to change and inconsistent use of new systems.
single_change: adoption of best international practices and embracing latest technological advancement in electoral affairs.

tech_adoption_barriers: Budget constraints,   Public confidence
implementation_concerns: Public Confidence
single_change: Transparency and more awareness campaigns

priority_1: Combating election-related disinformation and misinformation to safeguard electoral integrity and fairness.
priority_2: Enhancing measures to protect and promote the voting rights of persons with disabilities, women, older persons, and Indigenous peoples.
priority_3: Improving and upgrading polling and ballot-counting station equipment and materials, such as privacy screens for ballot marking.
documentation_challenges: Following the completion of ballot counting, certain clerical errors or omissions in the recorded vote figures on the polling and ballot-counting station reports were identified and subsequently corrected. These post-count corrections did not affect the election results.
tech_adoption_barriers: Taiwanese society broadly recognizes that traditional paper-based voting and the public announcement of each ballot during the counting process are more effective in ensuring electoral integrity and fairness.
implementation_concerns: Concerns regarding information security and whether the electoral process is conducted in an open and transparent manner.
single_change: Information technology is used to support manual ballot-counting operations in order to prevent clerical errors or omissions in polling and ballot-counting station reports and to enhance the accuracy of vote-counting results at polling stations.

priority_2: Capacity building and creation of awareness
tech_adoption_barriers: Infrastructure challenges
implementation_concerns: 1.Inadequate infrastructure support  2.Capacity building  3.Building trust in the systems
single_change: Go online on all processes  Train, train ,train

implementation_concerns: SLOW ADOPTION OF DIGITAL TRANSFORMATION

priority_1: Training software that would streamline our training
priority_2: Tracking and verification system for temperature staff
priority_3: Funding to deliver the systems that we require
implementation_concerns: Buy-in from the political leaders
single_change: More resources to recruit and retain technical staff and provide them with the latest technology to support their work

tech_adoption_barriers: political buy inn. Literacy of some political parties is low such that trust on newly introduced systems is hard to have.
implementation_concerns: some technologies may not be relevant in solving our problems.
single_change: Improved transparency for better social engagement.

priority_1: More effective Implementation of Out-of-Country Voting

priority_3: Up to date dashboard with electoral results

tech_adoption_barriers: Trust in technology
implementation_concerns: Acceptance by political parties and public and the reliability of the systems.
single_change: Real-time counting or registering of the results per polling station.

documentation_challenges: I think our documentation system is one of the best in the world. It goes through  great scrutiny so that we can have a free fair and a free from fear electoral, that's our mantra.
tech_adoption_barriers: I have not attempted to, I'm not involved in the technical aspect of the organization. I really cant give comments on that aspect
implementation_concerns: As I mentioned earlier I'm not an expert in that field, but I do think we need an update to a more modern way of doing things.
single_change: I do believe there's s O me trust in the way our elections are conducted. One thing i think we could improve on is the way in which ballots are counted and how and the voting process which we still do manually.

implementation_concerns: knowledge gap among the decision makers
single_change: freedom to work professionally

tech_adoption_barriers: - not adequate knowledge on technology and illiteracy
implementation_concerns: illiteracy and cyber security

priority_2: Strengthening digital security and system resilience
priority_3: Improving training and coordination with local election administrators
documentation_challenges: We had no challenges on this point.
tech_adoption_barriers: The lock of budget.
implementation_concerns: What concerns me most is ensuring that the new systems integrate smoothly with existing processes and that all team members receive adequate training to use them effectively.
single_change: Increasing transparency at every stage of the electoral process would greatly enhance public trust and resilience. This includes clear communication about procedures, open data on results, and independent auditing. Providing more public education about how elections are conducted and how results are verified would strengthen confidence and reduce misinformation.

tech_adoption_barriers: organisational structure
